Package it.polimi.ingsw.game_model.character

Class BagOfStudents

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.game_model.character.Character
it.polimi.ingsw.game_model.character.BagOfStudents
public class BagOfStudents extends Character
A class representing the bag of the game. A bag contains:
  • unpickedStudents - A list of all the students which are not already been played.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    BagOfStudents()
     

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addStudentsFirstPhase()
    Adds to the bag 2 students of each color (in total there will be 10 students in the bag after this method's execution).
    void
    addStudentsSecondPhase()
    Adds to the bag the remaining 120 students (24 foreach color).
    List<Student>
    drawNStudentFromBag(int n)
    Returns a list of the specified amount of students randomly picked (and removed) from the bag.
    Student
    drawStudentFromBag()
    Draw a random student from the bag.
    void
    insertBack(List<Student> students)
    Insert the given students into the back and shuffle it.
    boolean
    isEmpty()
    Returns whether the bag is empty or not.

  • Method Details

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Returns whether the bag is empty or not.
      Returns:
      a boolean value which indicates whether the bag is empty (bag size == 0) or not (bag size > 0).

    • addStudentsFirstPhase

      public void addStudentsFirstPhase()
      Adds to the bag 2 students of each color (in total there will be 10 students in the bag after this method's execution).

    • addStudentsSecondPhase

      public void addStudentsSecondPhase()
      Adds to the bag the remaining 120 students (24 foreach color).

    • drawStudentFromBag

      public Student drawStudentFromBag() throws BagEmptyException
      Draw a random student from the bag.
      Returns:
      a randomly picked student from the bag.
      Throws:
      BagEmptyException
      See Also:
      • Student

    • drawNStudentFromBag

      public List<Student> drawNStudentFromBag(int n) throws BagEmptyException
      Returns a list of the specified amount of students randomly picked (and removed) from the bag.
      Parameters:
      n - the amount of students to draw from the bag.
      Returns:
      a list of students randomly picked from the bag.
      Throws:
      BagEmptyException - if the bag is empty and drawing a student is not possible.

    • insertBack

      public void insertBack(List<Student> students)
      Insert the given students into the back and shuffle it.
      Parameters:
      students - the list of students which has to be added to the bag.
